name: EU Data Processing Agreement
text:
DATA PROCESSING AGREEMENT

This Data Processing Agreement ("DPA") is entered into as of January 1, 2024 between EuroCloud GmbH, registered in Germany ("Controller"), and ProcessorTech S.A., registered in Spain ("Processor").

1. DEFINITIONS
"Personal Data" means any information relating to an identified or identifiable natural person as defined in Article 4(1) GDPR.
"Processing" has the meaning given in Article 4(2) GDPR.
"Sub-processor" means any third party engaged by Processor to process Personal Data.

2. SCOPE AND ROLES
2.1 Controller is the controller of Personal Data. Processor is the processor.
2.2 Processor shall process Personal Data only on Controller's documented instructions.
2.3 This DPA applies to processing of Personal Data of Controller's customers and employees.

3. PROCESSING DETAILS
3.1 Subject Matter: Cloud hosting and data storage services.
3.2 Duration: For the term of the Services Agreement.
3.3 Nature: Storage, backup, transmission, and processing of data.
3.4 Purpose: To provide Services under the Agreement.
3.5 Categories: Customer data, account information, usage data.
3.6 Data Subjects: Controller's customers and employees.

4. PROCESSOR OBLIGATIONS
4.1 Instructions. Processor shall process Personal Data only on documented instructions from Controller, unless required by EU or Member State law.
4.2 Confidentiality. Processor shall ensure persons authorised to process Personal Data are bound by confidentiality obligations.
4.3 Security. Processor shall implement appropriate technical and organisational measures in accordance with Article 32 GDPR, including:
(a) Pseudonymisation and encryption;
(b) Ensuring ongoing confidentiality, integrity, availability;
(c) Ability to restore availability following incidents;
(d) Regular testing of security measures.
4.4 Sub-processing. Processor shall not engage Sub-processors without Controller's prior written authorisation. Currently authorised Sub-processors are listed in Annex II.
4.5 Assistance. Processor shall assist Controller in:
(a) Responding to data subject requests;
(b) Ensuring compliance with Articles 32-36 GDPR;
(c) Data protection impact assessments.
4.6 Records. Processor shall maintain records of processing activities as required by Article 30(2) GDPR.
4.7 Audits. Processor shall make available information necessary to demonstrate compliance and allow for audits.

5. DATA SUBJECT RIGHTS
Processor shall promptly notify Controller of any data subject requests and assist Controller in responding within required timeframes.

6. DATA BREACH
6.1 Processor shall notify Controller without undue delay (and in any event within 24 hours) after becoming aware of a Personal Data breach.
6.2 Notification shall include: (a) nature of breach; (b) data subjects affected; (c) likely consequences; (d) measures taken.

7. DATA TRANSFERS
7.1 Processor shall not transfer Personal Data outside the EEA without Controller's prior written consent and appropriate safeguards.
7.2 For transfers to third countries, the parties shall implement Standard Contractual Clauses (Module 2: Controller to Processor) as set forth in Commission Implementing Decision (EU) 2021/914.
7.3 Processor confirms that the laws of its jurisdiction allow it to fulfil its obligations under this DPA.

8. DELETION AND RETURN
Upon termination, Processor shall, at Controller's choice, delete or return all Personal Data and delete existing copies, unless storage is required by law.

9. SUB-PROCESSORS
9.1 Processor shall impose data protection obligations on Sub-processors equivalent to those in this DPA.
9.2 Processor shall notify Controller of any intended changes to Sub-processors.
9.3 Controller may object to new Sub-processors within 14 days of notification.

10. LIABILITY
Each party's liability under this DPA shall be subject to the limitations in the Services Agreement, except that such limitations shall not apply to GDPR fines imposed by supervisory authorities.

11. GOVERNING LAW
This DPA shall be governed by German law. The courts of Frankfurt shall have exclusive jurisdiction.

ANNEX I: Technical and Organisational Measures
ANNEX II: Authorised Sub-processors
ANNEX III: Standard Contractual Clauses

EUROCLOUD GMBH
By: _________________________

PROCESSORTECH S.A.
By: _________________________
